data.title: Where to watch Italy vs. Turkey live stream, TV channel, lineups, prediction for international friendly
data.meta_description: Euro 2020 winners Italy take on Turkey in friendly action on June 4 and here's the latest on TV and streaming services plus kickoff times.
data.text:
Italy, the reigning European champions, will continue their Euro 2024 preparations with a friendly match against Turkey in Bologna on Tuesday evening. Italy have won three of their last four games, with their only draw coming against Ukraine, which secured their qualification.

Turkey, on the other hand, had a strong qualifying run but suffered a heavy 6-1 loss to Austria recently.

Italy are set to defend their title in Germany, aiming to repeat their unexpected 2021 triumph. They overcame the sudden departure of coach Roberto Mancini last year, with new coach Luciano Spalletti guiding them to second place in Group C, avoiding a playoff.

Italy played two friendlies in the United States in the spring, defeating Venezuela and Ecuador. They have now gathered at Coverciano to face Turkey at Stadio Dall'Ara, followed by a match against Bosnia-Herzegovina in Empoli. They will then kick off their Euros campaign against Albania.

Turkey, like Italy, will make their Euro 2024 debut in Dortmund. Coach Vincenzo Montella's team, who topped Group D in qualifying, need a morale boost after recent defeats to Hungary and Austria. After facing Italy, Turkey will play a final warm-up match against Poland in Warsaw.

The Sporting News looks at the key details ahead of this game, including how to watch it across the world, kickoff times, and the latest lineup news.

What time does Italy vs. Turkey kick off?

This international friendly match takes place at the Stadio Renato Dall'Ara in Bologna, Italy and kicks off on Tuesday, June 4 at 9:00 p.m. local time.

Italy vs. Turkey lineups, team news

Italy's coach Luciano Spalletti has had to reduce his squad from 30 players. Francesco Acerbi is out due to groin surgery. Nicolo Zaniolo, Domenico Berardi, Destiny Udogie, and suspended midfielder Sandro Tonali are also unavailable.

Gianluca Scamacca, recalled to the team, won't play against Turkey. He and Atalanta BC teammate Giorgio Scalvini are involved in their final league game of the season.

Nicolo Fagioli, recently back from suspension, is surprisingly included, while Manuel Locatelli is left out. Gianluigi Donnarumma will captain Italy as Ciro Immobile is missing due to injuries and form issues. Mateo Retegui is likely to start up front.

Italy predicted XI (3-4-2-1, right to left): Donnarumma (GK) — Darmian, Buongiorno, Bastoni — Cambiaso, Barella, Jorginho, Dimarco — Pellegrini, Raspadori — Retegui.

Italy subs (9): TBC

For Turkey, defenders Caglar Soyuncu and Ridvan Yilmaz, and forward Cengiz Under are out with injuries.

However, Zeki Celik, Kenan Yildiz, and captain Hakan Calhanoglu are available. Calhanoglu, recently named Serie A midfielder of the year, is key for Turkey. Coach Vincenzo Montella will likely start Ugurcan Cakir as the goalkeeper, given Altay Bayindir’s lack of playing time at Manchester United.

Turkey predicted XI (4-2-3-1 right to left): Cakir (GK) — Celik, Demiral, Ayhan, Ozkacar — Calhanoglu, Ozcan — Akgun, Guler, Yildiz — Unal

Turkey subs (9): TBC

Italy vs. Turkey prediction

Both coaches will test their players and tactics before the major tournament. Both teams have some defensive concerns. However, Italy is the favorite to win the match. They also have a good record against Turkey.

Both nations qualified for Euro 2024 automatically. Neither team has been very convincing recently, especially in defense.
